intro: Streptolirion, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, adapting well to saline environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, with a silvery or grayish underside. Streptolirion species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are found in various regions around the Mediterranean and along the Atlantic coast.
